post_title: Apple WWDC 2024 set for June 10-14, promises to be 'A(bsolutely) I(ncredible)'
post_content:
Apple's annual World Wide Developer Conference (WWDC) is set to take place from June 10-14, according to Apple SVP Greg "Joz" Joswiak. In a tweet, Joswiak expressed his excitement for the event, describing it as "Absolutely Incredible." As the name suggests, WWDC is primarily focused on developers for Apple's operating systems. The event features panels, workshops, and serves as a platform for launching new ecosystems. This year's conference is expected to bring announcements regarding iOS and iPadOS 18, MacOS 15, and WatchOS 11, among others.

Given that it has been a year since the announcement of the Vision Pro, a lot of attention is expected around the headset and its VisionOS operating system. Updates to Apple Silicon and the possibility of new Macs are also anticipated. However, Apple's plans for artificial intelligence (AI) are likely to take center stage at the event. During the company's recent earnings call, CEO Tim Cook promised "groundbreaking innovation" in AI. WWDC seems like the ideal platform for Apple to make such an announcement, and there are rumors of a potential partnership with Google Gemini for the iPhone.

There have also been reports that iOS 18 will be a significant update, with AI tools to help manage daily life. While the concept of AI smartphones is not exclusive to Apple, Samsung has already embraced it with the launch of its Galaxy S24 line, which utilizes Google's Gemini efforts. Additionally, Apple claims that its new M3-powered MacBook Airs are the "World's Best Consumer Laptop for AI" due to the neural processing units included in its first-party System on a Chip (SoC).

Apple has announced that developers and students will have the opportunity to attend a special event at Apple Park on the opening day of WWDC. This is likely referring to the keynote that traditionally kicks off the conference. However, due to the ongoing pandemic, the event will be scaled down compared to previous years at the San Jose Convention Center.

The conference will also include a limited number of "winners" who will be invited to the in-person event in Cupertino. The announcement comes shortly after the Department of Justice filed a lawsuit against Apple, accusing the company of monopolistic practices relating to the iPhone.

Overall, WWDC 2024 promises to be an exciting event for developers and Apple enthusiasts alike. With anticipated announcements in AI, updates to operating systems, and potentially new hardware, it's clear that Apple is continuing to push the boundaries of innovation.
